name: Roo.Editor
desc: A base editor field that handles displaying/hiding on demand and has some built-in sizing and event handling logic.

params.name: field
params.desc: The Field object (or descendant)

params.name: config
params.desc: The config object

config.name: listeners
hideEl
config.desc: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed (defaults to true)

config.name: alignment
config.desc: The position to align to (see {@link Roo.Element#alignTo} for more details, defaults to "c-c?").

config.name: constrain
config.desc: True to constrain the editor to the viewport

config.name: shadow
config.desc:
"sides" for sides/bottom only, "frame" for 4-way shadow, and "drop"
for bottom-right shadow (defaults to "frame")

config.name: hideMode
config.desc:
y)
How this component should hidden. Supported values are
"visibility" (css visibility), "offsets" (negative offset position) and
"display" (css display) - defaults to "display".

config.name: value
config.desc: The data value of the underlying field (defaults to "")

config.name: allowDomMove
config.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

config.name: cancelOnEsc
config.desc: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed (defaults to false)

config.name: actionMode
config.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el' for forms you probably want to set this to fieldEl

config.name: completeOnEnter
config.desc: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

config.name: revertInvalid
config.desc:
True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field
validation fails (defaults to true)

config.name: disableClass
config.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

config.name: ignoreNoChange
config.desc:
True to skip the the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and
the value has not changed (defaults to false).  Applies only to string values - edits for other data types
will never be ignored.

config.name: autosize
config.desc:
True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field, "width" to adopt the width only,
or "height" to adopt the height only (defaults to false)

config.name: updateEl
config.desc: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes (defaults to false)

methods.name: cancelEdit
methods.desc:
Cancels the editing process and hides the editor without persisting any changes.  The field value will be
reverted to the original starting value.

params.name: remainVisible
params.desc:
Override the default behavior and keep the editor visible after
cancel (defaults to false)

methods.name: setSize
methods.desc: Sets the height and width of this editor.

params.name: width
params.desc: The new width

params.name: height
params.desc: The new height

methods.name: realign
methods.desc: Realigns the editor to the bound field based on the current alignment config value.

methods.name: getValue
methods.desc: Gets the data value of the editor

methods.name: completeEdit
methods.desc: Ends the editing process, persists the changed value to the underlying field, and hides the editor.

params.name: remainVisible
params.desc: Override the default behavior and keep the editor visible after edit (defaults to false)

methods.name: setValue
methods.desc: Sets the data value of the editor

params.name: value
params.desc: Any valid value supported by the underlying field

methods.name: startEdit
methods.desc: Starts the editing process and shows the editor.

params.name: el
params.desc: The element to edit

params.name: value
params.desc:
(optional) A value to initialize the editor with. If a value is not provided, it defaults
to the innerHTML of el.

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns the id of this component.

methods.name: render
methods.desc: If this is a lazy rendering component, render it to its container element.

params.name: container
params.desc: (optional) The element this component should be rendered into. If it is being applied to existing markup, this should be left off.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM,
removing the component from its {@link Roo.Container} (if applicable) and unregistering it from {@link Roo.ComponentMgr}.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.desc: Returns true if this component is visible.

methods.name: setDisabled
methods.desc: Convenience function for setting disabled/enabled by boolean.

methods.name: hide
methods.desc: Hide this component.

methods.name: focus
methods.desc: Try to focus this component.

params.name: selectText
params.desc: True to also select the text in this component (if applicable)

methods.name: show
methods.desc: Show this component.

methods.name: enable
methods.desc: Enable this component.

methods.name: setVisible
methods.desc: Convenience function to hide or show this component by boolean.

params.name: visible
params.desc: True to show, false to hide

methods.name: disable
methods.desc: Disable this component.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the underlying {@link Roo.Element}.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options
params.desc: (optional)

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to release

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The handler to remove

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

returns.desc: returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

returns.desc: True if the event is being listened for, else false

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: o
params.desc: The Observable to capture

params.name: fn
params.desc: The function to call

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: handler
params.desc: The method the event invokes

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: beforestartedit
events.desc:
Fires when editing is initiated, but before the value changes.  Editing can be canceled by returning
false from the handler of this event.

params.name: boundEl
params.desc: The underlying element bound to this editor

params.name: value
params.desc: The field value being set

events.name: beforecomplete
events.desc:
Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the underlying
field.  Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event.
Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this
event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

params.name: value
params.desc: The current field value

params.name: startValue
params.desc: The original field value

events.name: complete
events.desc: Fires after editing is complete and any changed value has been written to the underlying field.

params.name: value
params.desc: The current field value

params.name: startValue
params.desc: The original field value

events.name: specialkey
events.desc:
Fires when any key related to navigation (arrows, tab, enter, esc, etc.) is pressed.  You can check
{@link Roo.EventObject#getKey} to determine which key was pressed.

params.name: e
params.desc: The event object

events.name: startedit
events.desc: Fires when this editor is displayed

params.name: boundEl
params.desc: The underlying element bound to this editor

params.name: value
params.desc: The starting field value

events.name: beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: disable
events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.name: render
events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: destroy
events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.name: hide
events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

events.name: beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: enable
events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.
